most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Pieces OS account linking and authentication issues
common_issues.description: Users report persistent problems linking multiple accounts (Google, GitHub) and authentication failures after updates. Issues include infinite loading, 500 errors, and single account linking limitations.  Suggested solutions involve manual account merging, new auth service releases, checking Pieces toolbar login, and providing support logs for debugging.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Account Linking

### Key Points Raised:

* Johnkennyuk is having issues linking his personal domain email account to his GitHub account.
* The current account linking flow is not working properly.
* A new auth service is being developed and will be released in early/mid March.
* Johnkennyuk linked his accounts in the wrong order using the new auth app.

### Problems Identified:

* The current account linking flow is not user-friendly and has bugs.
* Johnkennyuk's personal domain email and GitHub email have a capitalization difference in the first character, which may be causing the linking issue.
* Johnkennyuk linked his accounts in the wrong order using the new auth app.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Mark-at-pieces offered to manually merge the accounts.
* Mark-at-pieces suggested waiting for the new auth service to be released.
* Mark-at-pieces reset Johnkennyuk's GitHub account multiple times.
* Johnkennyuk successfully linked his accounts using the new auth app but in the wrong order.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to help Johnkennyuk relink his accounts.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* Johnkennyuk's accounts are currently linked in the wrong order.
* Mark-at-pieces will help Johnkennyuk relink his accounts.
* The new auth service is expected to be released in early/mid March.

### Additional Notes:

* The new auth service will allow Johnkennyuk to link his personal domain email account to his GitHub account.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to schedule a meeting with Johnkennyuk to resolve the issue.
* Johnkennyuk expressed interest in being one of the first users to try out the new auth service.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* Users reported an issue with the authentication flow after updating Pieces OS to version 11.3.0. 
* They were unable to link their Google accounts through the provided URL and the page would get stuck in an infinite loading loop.

**Problems Identified:**

* Bug in the authentication flow introduced in the latest update.
* Manual refresh of the authentication page caused issues with the callback to the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested users to try logging in through the Pieces Toolbar or from one of their products.
* They also identified the issue as a bug in the new authentication flow and promised a fix within the next few hours.
* The issue was fixed and users were notified to try again.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The authentication issue has been resolved.
* Users confirmed that they were able to successfully log in after the fix was implemented.
* The issue is closed.

**Additional Notes:**

* For further troubleshooting, Mark-at-pieces requested users to provide support logs if the issue persisted.
* User @freccon provided screen recordings to help diagnose the issue.

**Overall, the issue was identified, acknowledged, and resolved within a day thanks to the collaborative effort of the users and the developers.**

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## Issue Summary

**Problem:** @utrack reports encountering an authorization error with Pieces on their Arch Linux system.

**Key points raised:**

- @utrack confirms they haven't found helpful information in existing support resources.
- @utrack expresses willingness to help debug in real-time via their calendar.
- @nathan-courtney-pieces requests the user's full log files and the specific Linux distribution version.
- @utrack provides the requested logs and mentions their OS version is Arch Linux Rolling (btw).
- @utrack offers to enable debug logs if instructed on how to do so.

**Proposed/implemented solutions:**

- @nathan-courtney-pieces requests full logs and OS version details for further investigation.

**Current status/outcome:**

- The issue remains open, awaiting analysis of the provided logs and additional troubleshooting.


**Additional Notes:**

- The user seems eager to resolve the issue promptly and actively participates in the troubleshooting process.
- Logs and specific OS version details may be vital for diagnosing and addressing the authorization problem.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Initialization and Login Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with Pieces OS/Desktop app initialization, including "Invalid Port" errors, database corruption leading to failure to start, and login failures with HTTP 500 errors. Solutions included using WinGet with elevated PowerShell for installation, database fixes in newer versions (11.3.2), and ongoing investigation for login issues on Linux.  Providing logs and OS details helps in troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* SherlockSol encountered an "Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect" error when opening Pieces Desktop.
* Other users (uzaxirr, zedevmed) reported experiencing the same issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The error indicates that Pieces Desktop was unable to bind to a local port properly, likely due to insufficient privileges.
* The .exe installer might not request administrative rights during the installation process.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* zedevmed proposed installing PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session to grant administrative privileges.
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and committed to adjusting the installation process.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The proposed solution by zedevmed using WinGet and elevated PowerShell seems to resolve the issue.
* Pieces team is actively working on adjusting the installation process to request administrative rights by default.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's hardware and Windows Build Number were requested for further investigation.
* A video call was offered to troubleshoot the issue live with the user.

**Overall, the issue seems to be resolved with the proposed solution. Pieces team is working on a permanent solution to prevent the issue from reoccurring.**

### Early Access Program

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting OS_Server!

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  WinDeployType: exe
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Channel : production

[D]  Setting Url Protocol Scheme for Inno Setup/ Squirrel Installs
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.625235  Logging to file: C:\Users\antoine\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Support/logs/log-04122025.txt

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting UI
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: false
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  stateStream#onListen
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#boot
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#attach
[38;5;12m[I][0m  initializeDataSingletons
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  Created our Tagify Files Locally.
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  User added tagify files now exist.
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 1ba7ab308a4b470ab996b360cc956398
[38;5;12m[I][0m  _controller.addError Unable to open database due to corruption LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #0      InternalCouchBaseDatabases.initializeCouchbase (package:database_facade/couchbase/singletons/internal_databases.dart)
<asynchronous suspension>
#1      OS.initializeDataSingletons (package:os_server/os.dart:909)
<asynchronous suspension>

<asynchronous suspension>

<asynchronous suspension>

[D]  Sentry Error Event: 2a48d07355694369b880fa84ef743112
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 9f79ad8b81a1493c955f24b3cf97db7e
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:05.956756  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: true
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

- User antoine79 reported an issue with their Pieces OS failing to launch.
- The problem appeared to be related to a corrupted database.
- User confirmed the issue persisted after clean install and attempted manual database deletion.

**Problems identified:**

- The initial bootup of the database failed due to corruption.
- Subsequent attempts to launch the application failed due to the same issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- The support team investigated the issue and identified a potential fix for the database corruption.
- A fix was implemented and released in version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS.

**Current status/outcome:**

- The issue is resolved with the release of version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS.

**Additional Information:**

- The user's CPU lacked AVX2 support, which is required for Pieces OS due to the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.
- The support team will make the older version of Pieces OS available or remove the AVX2 dependency for users with older CPUs.

**Conclusion:**

The issue with the Pieces OS failing to launch due to database corruption has been resolved. The user can now update to version 11.3.2 or wait for the support team to provide a solution for their specific CPU limitations.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crash/Failure to Start Due to Database Corruption
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS crashing or failing to start on macOS and Windows due to database corruption after updating to version 11.x.x.  Error messages included "Unexpected error occurred" and "LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized."  Solutions included checking for similar issues (#686), updating to the latest version (11.3.2), and potential workarounds for older CPUs lacking AVX2 support.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Pieces app crashing on macOS 12.3 (MacBook Air M2) with Plugins A, B, and C installed.
**Previous Version:** 10.9.5
**Expected Behavior:** App to launch without crashing.

**Key Points:**
* User experienced app crashes after updating to 11.3.1
* Issue reported on April 13, 2025
* User provided crash logs, operating system, hardware, plugins, and expected behavior
* Support team suspected similar issue as reported in #686
* User requested further assistance

**Problems Identified:**
* App crashes after updating to 11.3.1
* Potential compatibility issue with plugins

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**
* Support team suggested checking #686 for similar issue
* User requested a support call
* Latest version 11.3.2 released to resolve the issue

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* Latest version (11.3.2) released to address the issue
* User advised to update and re-open ticket if the problem persists

**Additional Notes:**
* User provided logs for further analysis.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

- User antoine79 reported an issue with their Pieces OS failing to launch.
- The problem appeared to be related to a corrupted database.
- User confirmed the issue persisted after clean install and attempted manual database deletion.

**Problems identified:**

- The initial bootup of the database failed due to corruption.
- Subsequent attempts to launch the application failed due to the same issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- The support team investigated the issue and identified a potential fix for the database corruption.
- A fix was implemented and released in version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS.

**Current status/outcome:**

- The issue is resolved with the release of version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS.

**Additional Information:**

- The user's CPU lacked AVX2 support, which is required for Pieces OS due to the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.
- The support team will make the older version of Pieces OS available or remove the AVX2 dependency for users with older CPUs.

**Conclusion:**

The issue with the Pieces OS failing to launch due to database corruption has been resolved. The user can now update to version 11.3.2 or wait for the support team to provide a solution for their specific CPU limitations.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @moazzem-pixel created an issue regarding Pieces OS not starting due to database corruption.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS fails to open due to database corruption.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue was identified as a duplicate of another existing issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686).
* The user was directed to continue the conversation on the original issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed as a duplicate.
* The user is advised to continue the conversation on the original issue thread.

**Additional Information:**

* The conversation occurred on April 14, 2025.
* Resources were provided for assistance with similar issues.

## Conclusion

The issue reported by @moazzem-pixel was identified as a duplicate and closed. The user is advised to continue the conversation on the original issue thread for further assistance.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving account linking and authentication issues as they are persistent and affect user experience.
Investigate and address the root cause of database corruption leading to OS/Desktop app crashes and startup failures.
Improve the installation process on Windows to prevent "Invalid Port" errors and ensure proper initialization.
Develop a more robust login process, especially for Linux users experiencing HTTP 500 errors.
Provide clear documentation or troubleshooting steps for users experiencing account linking and login issues.
Consider removing the AVX2 dependency or providing alternative solutions for users with older CPUs.
Proactively monitor and address issues related to new plugin integration to prevent application crashes.
Analyze support logs and user feedback to identify and fix recurring issues promptly.
Improve communication with users by providing timely updates and acknowledging reported issues.
Offer alternative support channels like live chat or email for non-critical issues to reduce call volume.
